hero.title: Take control of your finances
hero.description: Payable gives you support and guidance to help you better manage your debts.

imagesSection.image1Text: Everyone should feel the freedom of being debt-free.
imagesSection.image2Text: Every day we help people become debt-free.

helpSection.heading: Together we will find a solution
helpSection.description: It is important to tackle your debt as soon as possible to avoid additional fees and costs.

steps.title: 1. Log in to My Pages
steps.description: There you will see your current debt. You can also use the bankgiro from the letter you received.

steps.title: 2. Choose a payment method

steps.title: 3. Complete the payment
steps.description: The payment is registered within 1-2 business days. You can see your updated balance on My Pages.

whyPay.heading: Why it is important to pay

points.title: Improve your credit rating
points.description: By paying your debt, you can improve your credit score, making it easier to get loans and credit in the future.

points.title: Avoid additional costs
points.description: Unpaid debts can lead to extra fees and interest charges, increasing your total debt. Penalty interest is calculated continuously on the debt.

points.title: Reduce stress and worry
points.description: Having unpaid debts can cause a lot of stress and worry. By paying off your debt, you can gain peace of mind and focus on other important aspects of your life.

points.title: Better control over your finances
points.description: By paying off your debts, you'll have better control over your financial situation and can plan for the future more securely.

points.title: Avoid legal actions
points.description: If the debt is not paid, Payable may take legal actions, which can lead to additional costs and problems.

points.title: Improve your relationships
points.description: By paying your debts on time, you can avoid conflicts with creditors and maintain trust with friends and family who may have lent you money.

items.trigger: Why is Payable sending me a demand letter on my credit?
items.content: Payable AB is a company that buys larger portfolios of overdue and terminated credits from banks and finance companies. This means that Payable AB owns the terminated credit, and you should have a dialogue with our customer service to discuss how to settle it.
Payable is contacting you to inform you about an unpaid debt. If you are unable to pay the full amount, please contact us, and we can explore alternative solutions together.

items.trigger: What happens if I don’t pay my debt?
items.content: If you do not pay your debt, it can lead to additional actions, including legal measures (a payment order application via the Enforcement Authority), which could result in a record of non-payment. A non-payment record remains on file for three years. Additionally, further fees and interest charges will accrue. To avoid this, please contact us to see if we can find a solution together.

items.trigger: What does the debt collection process look like?
items.content: A debt collection notice is the first step in the debt collection process. By law, the collection agency has the right to charge a fee of 180 SEK. Twelve days after the debt collection notice is sent, Payable can apply for a payment order via the Enforcement Authority.

items.trigger: Can I negotiate a payment plan?
items.content: Yes, we are open to discussing alternative payment plans that suit your financial situation. Contact us to discuss your options.

items.trigger: How does this affect my credit rating?
items.content: Non-payment records appear on credit reports. This can make it difficult to obtain new credit, loans, credit cards, or secure a rental apartment or housing contract. A non-payment record will remain for three years. It is important to address debts promptly to avoid negative effects on your credit rating.

items.trigger: Can I get an explanation of the current debt?
items.content: Of course, we can provide a detailed explanation of the debt and any associated fees. Contact us for more information.

items.trigger: What are my rights as a debtor?
items.content: As a debtor, you have rights under the law, including the right to clear information about your debt and the right to request proof of the debt. You also have the right to ensure that the matter is handled according to good debt collection practice, which Payable always follows.

items.trigger: How can I contact you to settle my debt?
items.content: You can contact us by phone or email to discuss your debt and possible payment arrangements.

items.trigger: What if I am not satisfied with how you are handling my debt?
items.content: Payable believes in handling matters fairly, accurately, and respectfully, following all laws and regulations for collection agencies. If you are not satisfied with our handling, please contact our customer service as soon as possible.

aboutUs.heading: About Payable
aboutUs.description: Payable AB specializes in buying and managing overdue consumer credits. We have extensive experience finding solutions for debtors through guidance and payment arrangements. Payable AB is authorized by the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority to conduct debt collection operations under the Debt Collection Act (1974:182).

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.content: This privacy policy describes how Payable AB collects, uses, stores, and protects personal data in connection with our debt collection activities. We are committed to safeguarding your privacy and ensuring that your personal data is processed in accordance with applicable data protection laws, including the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

sections.title: 2. Personal Data We Collect
sections.content: We may collect the following types of personal data: Identification details: Name, personal ID number, date of birth, ID number. Contact details: Address, phone number, email address. Financial information: Bank account details, debt information, payment history. Customer service information: Communication with customer service, case history. Technical details: IP address, browser details, cookies, and similar technologies.

sections.title: 3. Purposes of Processing Personal Data
sections.content: We process your personal data for the following purposes: Debt management: Managing and collecting unpaid debts. Communication: Contacting you via phone, email, letter, or other channels regarding your debt. Customer service: Responding to your inquiries and handling your cases. Legal purposes: Fulfilling legal obligations, such as complying with laws and regulations and responding to legal claims. Service improvement: Analyzing and improving our services and customer experience.

sections.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
sections.content: We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds: Contract: To fulfill our contractual obligations to you. Legal obligation: To meet legal obligations we are subject to. Legitimate interest: To conduct our business, including debt collection, and improve our services. Consent: Where applicable, such as for marketing purposes.

sections.title: 5. Sharing of Personal Data
sections.content: We may share your personal data with: Service providers: Companies providing services to us, such as IT support, payment services, and customer service. Authorities: Legal bodies and regulatory authorities when required by law. Business partners: Companies we collaborate with to deliver our services.

sections.title: 6. Transfer of Personal Data Outside the EU/EEA
sections.content: Your personal data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside the EU/EEA. In such cases, we ensure that appropriate safeguards are in place, such as standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission.

sections.title: 7. Retention of Personal Data
sections.content: We store your personal data for as long as necessary for the purposes for which it was collected or as required by law. When your personal data is no longer needed, it will be deleted or anonymized.

sections.title: 8. Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to: Access your personal data: Request a copy of the personal data we hold about you. Correct inaccurate data: Request that incorrect or incomplete data be corrected. Delete your personal data: Request the deletion of your personal data under certain circumstances. Restrict processing: Request that the processing of your personal data be restricted under certain circumstances. Object to processing: Object to the processing of your personal data based on legitimate interest or for direct marketing purposes. Data portability: Request that your personal data be transferred to another service provider.

sections.title: 9. Contact Information
sections.content: If you have any questions about this privacy policy or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us.

sections.title: 10. Changes to the Privacy Policy
sections.content: We may update this privacy policy as necessary. The latest version will always be available on our website. We encourage you to regularly review this policy to stay informed about how we protect your personal data. Last updated: 2024-06-10. By using our services, you agree to this privacy policy.

hero.title: Experienced Partner for Non-Performing Loans
hero.subtext: Payable specializes in buying overdue consumer loans from banks and financial institutions.

items.title: One-Off
items.description: A one-off transaction means Payable purchases an existing portfolio of non-performing loans. The price is based on an analysis of the portfolio's future cash flow. The lender avoids future management, strengthens key financial metrics, and gets paid upon portfolio handover.

items.title: Forward Flow
items.description: A forward flow agreement means that a financial institution can continuously sell overdue credit agreements at a pre-determined price. The conditions for each transfer, including price and volume, are defined in the agreement.

items.title: Joint Ventures
items.description: Payable has an extensive network of potential partners and vast experience in creating custom solutions.

items.title: Backstop Regulation
items.description: The new EU regulation increases pressure on financial institutions to handle Non-Performing Loans (NPL) more effectively.

items.title: Stronger Balance Sheet
items.description: A stronger balance sheet with a lower proportion of problem loans can increase confidence among stakeholders.

items.title: Proactive Risk Management
items.description: Proactive risk management increases market confidence.

items.title: Administrative Costs
items.description: Managing non-performing loans requires resources. By selling, these costs are reduced.

items.title: Improved Credit Rating
items.description: A lower proportion of NPLs on the balance sheet can lead to improved credit ratings from rating agencies.

items.title: Results and Liquidity
items.description: A sale releases capital and improves liquidity.

process.heading: Sales Process

steps.title: 1. NDA
steps.description: The parties sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA).

steps.title: 2. Analysis
steps.description: An analysis of the portfolio is conducted using sophisticated valuation models.

steps.title: 3. Offer
steps.description: We submit an offer with the price expressed as a percentage of the portfolio's outstanding capital.

steps.title: 4. Due Diligence
steps.description: Upon acceptance of the offer, due diligence is carried out.

steps.title: 5. Agreement
steps.description: We sign an agreement for the current sale.

steps.title: 6. Transfer and Payment
steps.description: The credits are transferred to Payable, and you get paid.

process.priceIndication: Would you like to quickly evaluate what a sale would mean for you? To provide a non-binding price indication, we only need a few details.

sections.title: 1. Purpose
sections.content: The purpose of this policy is to ensure that Payable AB handles customer complaints in an effective, fair, and transparent manner. We strive to treat all complaints seriously and resolve them in a way that benefits both the customer and the company.

sections.title: 2. Definition of Complaint
sections.content: A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction from a customer regarding our service, product, or the treatment they have received from our employees. This may include, but is not limited to, complaints about incorrect billing, unsatisfactory service, lack of communication, and handling of personal data.

subsections.subTitle: 3.1 Accessibility
subsections.content: We will make it easy for customers to submit complaints.

subsections.subTitle: 3.2 Impartiality
subsections.content: Complaints will be handled in a fair and objective manner.

subsections.subTitle: 3.3 Confidentiality
subsections.content: Customer privacy will be protected when handling complaints.

subsections.subTitle: 3.4 Responsibility
subsections.content: We will take responsibility to address and resolve complaints quickly and effectively.

subsections.subTitle: 3.5 Continuous Improvement
subsections.content: We use feedback from complaints to continuously improve our services.

subsections.subTitle: 4.1 Submitting a Complaint
subsections.content:
Customers can submit complaints in the following ways:
• Email: kundservice@payable.se
• Mail: Payable AB, Box 43, 191 21 Sollentuna

Please include the following information in your complaint:
• Your full name and contact details
• Case number
• A clear description of your complaint
• Any relevant documentation that supports your complaint

subsections.subTitle: 4.2 Acknowledgement of Receipt
subsections.content: When we receive a complaint, we will acknowledge it within 2 working days. The acknowledgement will include information on how the complaint will be handled and an expected timeline for resolution.

subsections.subTitle: 4.3 Investigation
subsections.content: Each complaint will be thoroughly and impartially investigated. We may need to contact the customer for additional information or clarification.

subsections.subTitle: 4.4 Decision and Actions
subsections.content: After the investigation, we will make a decision and take appropriate actions to resolve the complaint. The customer will be informed of the decision and the actions that will be taken.

subsections.subTitle: 4.5 Feedback
subsections.content: We aim to resolve complaints within 14 working days from the date of receipt. If more time is needed, we will inform the customer of the reason for the delay and provide a new expected resolution timeframe.

sections.title: 5. Escalation of Complaints
sections.content: If the customer is not satisfied with how the complaint has been handled, the matter can be escalated to a senior manager or the person responsible for customer complaints. If necessary, the customer may also refer the complaint to an external dispute resolution body, such as the National Board for Consumer Disputes (ARN) or the relevant supervisory authority.

sections.title: 6. Documentation and Reporting
sections.content: All complaints and actions taken will be carefully documented. We will regularly review and analyze complaints to identify patterns and opportunities for improvement.

sections.title: 7. Training and Awareness
sections.content: All employees will receive training on this complaints handling policy and how to effectively manage complaints. We will ensure that all employees are aware of the importance of handling complaints professionally and respectfully.

sections.title: 8. Review and Updates
sections.content: This policy will be reviewed and updated annually to ensure it remains effective and relevant. Any changes will be communicated to all employees and made available to our customers.

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.content: This Code of Conduct outlines the principles and standards that guide the behavior of all employees, leaders, and partners of Payable AB. Our goal is to conduct our business in an ethical, fair, and transparent manner while protecting and respecting the rights of our customers.

sections.title: 2. Ethical Principles
sections.content:
Honesty and Integrity: Always act with honesty and integrity in all our business relationships. 
Respect: Treat all individuals with respect, dignity, and fairness. 
Responsibility: Take responsibility for our actions and decisions, acting in the best interest of the company and the customer.

sections.title: 3. Customer Treatment
sections.content:
Respectful Communication: We will always communicate with customers in a respectful, courteous, and professional manner. 
Customer Rights: We respect the rights of customers and work to ensure that our practices comply with applicable laws and regulations. 
Confidentiality: We protect the personal information of customers and handle it in accordance with our privacy policy.

sections.title: 4. Compliance with Laws and Regulations
sections.content:
Legislation: We comply with all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards governing our operations. 
Anti-corruption: We do not tolerate any form of corruption or bribery. All business decisions must be based on business considerations. 
Reporting Violations: Employees are encouraged to report any violations of this code of conduct or legislation without fear of retaliation.

sections.title: 5. Conflicts of Interest
sections.content:
Identification and Avoidance: Employees should avoid situations where personal interests may conflict with the interests of the company or customers. 
Transparency: Any conflicts of interest should be immediately reported to the nearest manager or compliance officer for evaluation and resolution.

sections.title: 6. Employee Behavior
sections.content:
Professional Conduct: Employees are expected to behave professionally and maintain the company’s good reputation in all their actions. 
Collaboration: We promote a work environment of collaboration, mutual respect, and support. 
Continuing Education: Employees are encouraged to continuously develop their knowledge and skills to better serve our customers and fulfill their responsibilities.

sections.title: 7. Environment and Society
sections.content:
Environmental Responsibility: We strive to minimize our environmental impact and follow sustainable business practices. 
Social Responsibility: We are committed to supporting local communities and participating in socially responsible initiatives.

sections.title: 8. Handling of Complaints
sections.content:
Customer Complaints: We have clear procedures in place to handle customer complaints quickly and fairly. All complaints will be taken seriously and handled confidentially. 
Internal Complaints: Employees should feel safe to report issues or complaints internally. We ensure that these are handled fairly and without retaliation.

sections.title: 10. Review and Updates
sections.content: This code of conduct will be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure that it remains relevant and effective. Any changes will be communicated to all employees and partners.
